profileAlternative.name: Marcus Biel
profileAlternative.headline: Java/Cloud Freelancer Munich/Remote at Clean Code Academy
profileAlternative.summary:
Marcus Biel (@MarcusBiel) is a well-known software craftsman, Java influencer and Clean Code Evangelist. He is also a regular speaker at Java conferences all over the world, such as JBCN Conf Barcelona, JavaZone Oslo and Oracle Code One in San Francisco. Besides this, he works as a technical reviewer for renowned Java books such as Effective Java, Core Java SE 9 for the Impatient or Java by Comparison.

Marcus is well-known in the Java community, with a total of 75 000 followers across various social media platforms. In 2017, the editorial team at jaxenter.com rated him #13 in their list of the world’s top Java influencers.

Consulting Services Profile
Marcus offers services such as coaching of development teams in topics such as Java architecture and development, refactoring and clean code, cloud infrastructure, test automation, agile methodologies, and continuous deployment. He also offers requirements analysis, business, and technical design, implementation and code reviews.

International Conference Appearances 2019

JavaForum Stuttgart, 4th July, Stuttgart, Germany
http://bit.ly/2S1Umhi

Devoxx Poland, 24th of June, Krakow, Poland
http://bit.ly/2Jw797Z

positions.title: Director of Developer Experience / Principal Product Manager Technical
positions.description:
Helping create the vision for Red Hat's tools and technology and inspiring professional software and systems engineers to solve problems. Leading Developer Experience strategies across multiple product teams.

Responsibilities:
• Creating technical content
• Speaking at conferences
• Empowering engineers by delivering hands-on workshops
• Building partnerships with individuals, companies, and organizations
• Connecting with other engineers to identify how Red Hat might help them to be even more successful
• Gathering product feedback that will inform engineering decision-making
• Supporting engineers on forums, social media, meet-ups and other places
…
see more

positions.title: Freelance
positions.description:
Responsible for design, development, test and maintenance of distributed, large scale resilient systems. Backend / Middleware Development - Mostly SOA Webservices and Batch-Jobs
Java 8, Spring 4, Spring Batch, JPA 2.1, Mockito, PowerMock, Junit, Maven, Sonar Qube

positions.title: Java Freelancer
positions.description:
Loadbalanced Jboss-domain-clustering in consideration of fulltime availability and full system resilience.

Jboss AS 7.1, Apache 2.2, Modcluster 1.2, Linux, MySQL 5, Maven 3.0.4, Hudson 2.x, Nexus 2.x

positions.title: Senior Software Engineer Java
positions.description:
Processing of nfc/ credit card-transactions in in the six-figure range, in real time as well as in batch operations, in consideration of performance and full reliability. Rest and SOAP based remote communication (B2B and B2C), web frontend extensions,
specifying design-, architecture- and implementation-guidelines for the whole development team, interviews with new developers and acting as direct interface to product management.

…
see more

positions.title: Senior Software Developer Java
positions.description: Development of the UI of a SOAP-based stock-market-ordering-proxy, introduction of quality guidelines using Sonar Server, release-management and productive rollout on a tomcat-cluster in consideration of fulltime availability and full system resilience

positions.title: Developer Frontend
positions.description:
Man in charge for SEO and XML local search interface, as used by bing maps. Analysis, design and implementation of a technical concept which increased the number of unique visitors of the local search engine by ten times.
Based on my own (freetime) initiative, conversion of all development projects from Maven 1 to Maven2, inhouse training of all developer colleagues, integration of Hudson and Nexus as the company’s CI environment
Frontend development (Java, HTML, CSS, Ajax) for a local search engine
…
see more

positions.title: Intern
positions.description:
Thesis: Cash Office – The design and implementation of a retail cash management application in a store environment (Java Swing + JGoodies Forms Framework)

Used Tools & Technologies
Java SE 5, Swing, JGoodies Framework, SQL, MS SQL, Tomcat 5.5, Eclipse 3.2
…
see more

positions.title: Working Student
positions.description:
Extensions for PHP based image database
Extensions for an XML Parser
Development of an interface for a barcode scanner
Java SE 5, J2EE 1.4, Struts 1.2, PHP 4, XML, Maven 1, Apache, Tomcat 5.5, DB2, Eclipse 3.1

positions.title: Intern
positions.description:
Refactoring of a Java CMS
JUnit Testing
Acceptance Tests with Fitnesse
SEO Optimization of a Website
Java SE 1.4, J2EE 1.4, Servlets, JSP, SEO, Fit + FitNesse, JBoss, Eclipse 2.1
…
see more

positions.title: Intern
positions.description:
Implementation of a PHP SMS Module
Development of user interfaces with access to a database in VB.Net
Database design for MySQL and MS SQL Server
PHP 4, VB.NET, SQL, MySQL, Visual Studio, MS SQL Server, Dreamweaver

positions.title: Intern
positions.description:
Development of a Struts-based user interface to simplify queries to an Oracle database for BMW vehicle parts.
Java SE 1.4, J2EE 1.3, Struts 1.02, Tomcat 4.1, JDBC, SQL, Oracle, Eclipse 2.0

positions.title: Intern
positions.description: Working as a technical editor, editorial meetings, research for magazine articles, composition of magazine news flashs, Hardware benchmarking

positions.title: Social service in lieu of military service
positions.description: 08/2000 - 07/2001 Office work, child care, computer administration, implementation of a PHP based website including a self-written CMS and some SEO (www.ekp.de)
